title: Rappelling
short_description: Descend vertical rock faces or waterfalls using ropes and technical gear.
long_description:
Rappelling (abseiling) is the controlled descent off a vertical drop, such as a rock face, using a rope. While climbing is about going up, rappelling is the thrill of coming down. In India, this activity has spawned a unique and thrilling variant: Waterfall Rappelling (Canyoning).

During the monsoon, seasonal waterfalls in the Western Ghats (Maharashtra) become hotspots for this. Imagine descending a 100-foot slippery rock face with a roaring waterfall pounding against your helmet. It's an intense sensory experience combining the fear of heights with the force of water. Dry rappelling is also popular in Manali and Rishikesh as part of adventure camps.

opening_hours.time_notes: Waterfall activities are strictly daylight only.

operating_season.off_season: Heavy rain days may cancel events due to flash flood risk.
operating_season.season_notes: Maharashtra is the hub for waterfall rappelling.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Includes all technical gear (harness, helmet, gloves).

safety_guidelines: Keep your strong hand on the rope behind your hip (brake hand) - never let go.
Wear a helmet to protect from falling loose rocks.
Trust the harness; leaning back (perpendicular to rock) makes it easier.
equipment_checklist: Full-finger gloves (usually provided) to prevent rope burn
major_experiences: Walking backwards off a cliff edge
The view from the halfway point

sample_itinerary.one_day: 6:00 AM: Leave Mumbai. 9:00 AM: Reach Vihigaon. Breakfast + Trek to falls (30 mins). 10:00 AM: Briefing & Setup. 10:30 AM: Rappelling starts. 2:00 PM: Lunch at village. 4:00 PM: Return.

booking_methods: Adventure clubs in Mumbai/Pune (Trek Mates, Bhatakna)
booking_details.suggested_stay: Day trips are common. For Rishikesh, stay in Tapovan.
booking_details.how_to_reach: Vihigaon is near Kasara station (local train from Mumbai).
